page.title: 05BINHAM MANOR FARM
page.content: Binham farm is a good example of a typical farm in this area. It is 424 acres (171 hectares) in size and is given over entirely to breeding for milk production. The farm has 240 cows in milk, all the fields being used for forrage feed and winter feed for the cows. The entire area of farm land is given over to grass. Nitrogen and potash are used on the land to improve grass production and most of the grass is put to sileage for winter feed. Due to milk quotas from the EEC, The farm produces 10% less milk than l983 and they have to take great care not to overproduce milk. Therefore the farm is working on breeds that produce less milk while using the land to its full potential.
